alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Emmet; Hancock; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Winnebago; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 9:15PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Significant Winter Storm Potential Wednesday Into Thursday... .A large winter storm will produce prolonged precipitation across the region. Initially a round of snow will produce light accumulations mainly over Minnesota but extending just over the border into far northern Iowa late Tuesday and Tuesday night. However, a heavier and more widespread accumulation is then anticipated from Wednesday into Thursday. This will fall primarily as snow in north and northwest Iowa and neighboring states, but a mix or freezing rain is increasingly likely further toward north-central into eastern Iowa. Strong and gusty winds are also anticipated, leading to areas of blowing snow in the north and northwest and worsening impacts from the storm. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy winter precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with higher amounts possible towards the state border. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph at times. * WHERE...Northern Iowa. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
